fields.value: Replication data for: Measuring State and District Ideology with Spatial Realignment

dsDescriptionValue.value: Data and R code for measuring state and district public opinion in 2008 with a kriging model. Survey data are from the 2008 Cooperative Congressional Election Study. Geographic data include shapefiles, ZIP code centroids and attributes, and USDA urban-rural classifications. Demographic data are drawn from Census data and the Association of Statisticians of American Religious Bodies' 2000 Religious Congregations and Membership Study.

publicationCitation.value: Monogan, III, James E. and Jeff Gill. 2015. "Measuring State and District Ideology with Spatial Realignment." Political Science Research and Methods.

files.description: R code to measure state and district ideology in two alternate ways: Subsetting the raw data by constituency and multi-level regression with poststratification. Calls the input files of cces08reformatted.dta and krigedPoints.csv.
files.label: alternateMeasures.R

dataFile.description: R code to measure state and district ideology in two alternate ways: Subsetting the raw data by constituency and multi-level regression with poststratification. Calls the input files of cces08reformatted.dta and krigedPoints.csv.

files.description: The 2000 Religious Congregations and Membership Study, provided by the ARDA. Users of these data must cite the Association of Statisticians of American Religious Bodies and visit the original study page for documentation: http://www.thearda.com/Archive/Files/Descriptions/RCMSST.asp
files.label: arda2000.tab

dataFile.description: The 2000 Religious Congregations and Membership Study, provided by the ARDA. Users of these data must cite the Association of Statisticians of American Religious Bodies and visit the original study page for documentation: http://www.thearda.com/Archive/Files/Descriptions/RCMSST.asp

files.description: 2008 Cooperative Congressional Election Study common output file (hdl:1902.1/14003). Usage of these data requires citation of the original study. More information can be found at: http://hdl.handle.net/1902.1/14003
files.label: cces08_common_output.tab

dataFile.description: 2008 Cooperative Congressional Election Study common output file (hdl:1902.1/14003). Usage of these data requires citation of the original study. More information can be found at: http://hdl.handle.net/1902.1/14003

files.description: Revised 2008 CCES data created by the program ccesManagement.R. Usage of these data requires citation of the original input data from CCES, the Census Bureau, and the USDA.
files.label: cces08reformatted.tab

dataFile.description: Revised 2008 CCES data created by the program ccesManagement.R. Usage of these data requires citation of the original input data from CCES, the Census Bureau, and the USDA.

files.description: R code for reshaping 2008 CCES data for geographic analysis. Required input files are zcta5.txt, ruralurbancodes2003.csv, and cces08_common_output.dta. The output file, cces08reformatted.dta, is also posted. This code serves to illustrate spatial data management, but need not be used to replicate our findings.
files.label: ccesManagement.R

dataFile.description: R code for reshaping 2008 CCES data for geographic analysis. Required input files are zcta5.txt, ruralurbancodes2003.csv, and cces08_common_output.dta. The output file, cces08reformatted.dta, is also posted. This code serves to illustrate spatial data management, but need not be used to replicate our findings.

files.description: 2000 Census 1% unweighted sample. Original data drawn from the Minnesota Population Center (http://www.ipums.org).
files.label: census2000.tab

dataFile.description: 2000 Census 1% unweighted sample. Original data drawn from the Minnesota Population Center (http://www.ipums.org).

files.description: Documentation describing the order to implement the R code, explaining the nature of every available data file, and describing each variable in detail for the two primary input files and two final product files.
files.label: docKriging08.txt

dataFile.description: Documentation describing the order to implement the R code, explaining the nature of every available data file, and describing each variable in detail for the two primary input files and two final product files.

files.description: Output file from krigingMeasuresSetupZIP.R, which uses ZIP-level population data when drawing covariates. This file contains simulated citizens in the lower 48 states and Virginia congressional districts. Locations in space as well as covariate values drawn from the population are included for each simulated respondent.
files.label: krigedPoints.csv

dataFile.description: Output file from krigingMeasuresSetupZIP.R, which uses ZIP-level population data when drawing covariates. This file contains simulated citizens in the lower 48 states and Virginia congressional districts. Locations in space as well as covariate values drawn from the population are included for each simulated respondent.

files.description: Old version of output file from krigingMeasuresSetupState.R, which uses state-level and district-level population data when drawing covariates. This file contains simulated citizens in the lower 48 states and Virginia congressional districts. Locations in space as well as covariate values drawn from the population are included for each simulated respondent.
files.label: krigedPointsSTATE.csv

dataFile.description: Old version of output file from krigingMeasuresSetupState.R, which uses state-level and district-level population data when drawing covariates. This file contains simulated citizens in the lower 48 states and Virginia congressional districts. Locations in space as well as covariate values drawn from the population are included for each simulated respondent.

files.description: R code that must be run over a blade computer. This program fits a model using Bootstrap Random Spatial Sampling (BRSS). Uses the input files cces08reformatted.dta, krigedPoints.csv. Outputs are several text files with the prefix of 'sample' and 'forecast' to be post-processed for inferences and district measurement.
files.label: krigingMeasuresModeling.R

dataFile.description: R code that must be run over a blade computer. This program fits a model using Bootstrap Random Spatial Sampling (BRSS). Uses the input files cces08reformatted.dta, krigedPoints.csv. Outputs are several text files with the prefix of 'sample' and 'forecast' to be post-processed for inferences and district measurement.

files.description: R code to diagnose the best spatial model and create a kriging sample of simulated citizens. Required input files are cces08reformatted.dta, census2000.dta, ruralurbancodes2003b.csv, and arda2000.DTA. This program results in the output file krigedPoints.csv, which is then used in the actual forecasting model.
files.label: krigingMeasuresSetupState.R

dataFile.description: R code to diagnose the best spatial model and create a kriging sample of simulated citizens. Required input files are cces08reformatted.dta, census2000.dta, ruralurbancodes2003b.csv, and arda2000.DTA. This program results in the output file krigedPoints.csv, which is then used in the actual forecasting model.

files.description: R code to diagnose the best spatial model and create a kriging sample of simulated citizens. Required input files are cces08reformatted.dta, census2000.dta, ruralurbancodes2003b.csv, and arda2000.DTA. This program results in the output file krigedPoints.csv, which is then used in the actual forecasting model.
files.label: krigingMeasuresSetupZIP.R

dataFile.description: R code to diagnose the best spatial model and create a kriging sample of simulated citizens. Required input files are cces08reformatted.dta, census2000.dta, ruralurbancodes2003b.csv, and arda2000.DTA. This program results in the output file krigedPoints.csv, which is then used in the actual forecasting model.

files.description: A zip file containing 100 files with the prefix "sample" and 100 files with the prefix "forecast." These 200 comma-separated value files were created from the file krigingMeasuresModeling.R and used to compute the final estimates we compiled in resultProcessing.R. The "sample" files together make-up our Monte Carlo sample of the marginal posterior distributions, and the "forecast" files together make-up our sample of locational forecasts to compute the kriged ideology in states and congressional districts.
files.label: krigingOutput.zip

dataFile.description: A zip file containing 100 files with the prefix "sample" and 100 files with the prefix "forecast." These 200 comma-separated value files were created from the file krigingMeasuresModeling.R and used to compute the final estimates we compiled in resultProcessing.R. The "sample" files together make-up our Monte Carlo sample of the marginal posterior distributions, and the "forecast" files together make-up our sample of locational forecasts to compute the kriged ideology in states and congressional districts.

files.description: 2000 Census data from the National Historical Geographic Information System (http://nhgis.org). Presents the joint distribution of sex, race, and age by ZIP code.
files.label: nhgis0005_ds146_2000_zcta.csv

dataFile.description: 2000 Census data from the National Historical Geographic Information System (http://nhgis.org). Presents the joint distribution of sex, race, and age by ZIP code.

files.description: 2000 Census data from the National Historical Geographic Information System (http://nhgis.org). Presents the sex-conditional distribution of education and employment status. Also presents the unconditional distribution of income and homeownership.
files.label: nhgis0005_ds151_2000_zcta.csv

dataFile.description: 2000 Census data from the National Historical Geographic Information System (http://nhgis.org). Presents the sex-conditional distribution of education and employment status. Also presents the unconditional distribution of income and homeownership.

files.description: This code reads all of the "sample" and "forecast" files generated by krigingMeasuresModeling.R to summarize the model and finalize the aggregate forecasts. The code also reads in the files stateMeasures.dta and vaDistMeasures.dta to create maps, scatterplots, and correlations of the various measures of ideology.
files.label: resultProcessing.R

dataFile.description: This code reads all of the "sample" and "forecast" files generated by krigingMeasuresModeling.R to summarize the model and finalize the aggregate forecasts. The code also reads in the files stateMeasures.dta and vaDistMeasures.dta to create maps, scatterplots, and correlations of the various measures of ideology.

files.description: Revised version of the USDA 2003 rural-urban data. Virginia's independent cities are aggregated with adjacent counties whenever the Census pools them for statistical purposes.
files.label: ruralurbancodes2003b.csv

files.description: Output measures of public opinion for the lower 48 states. Includes kriging estimates, variance in the estimates, multi-level regression with poststratification (and its variance), unweighted survey subsetting, and weighted survey subsetting.
files.label: stateMeasures.tab

dataFile.description: Output measures of public opinion for the lower 48 states. Includes kriging estimates, variance in the estimates, multi-level regression with poststratification (and its variance), unweighted survey subsetting, and weighted survey subsetting.

files.description: Census Tiger/Line Shapefiles for Virginia's congressional districts in the 110th congress. User should unzip the file and keep the unzipped folder tl_2008_51_cd110 containing the component files in the working directory. Originally accessed from: ftp://ftp2.census.gov/geo/tiger/TIGER2008/51_VIRGINIA/
files.label: tl_2008_51_cd110.zip
